Reviews.Content: Just average.. Stayed there for the first time as I had to do business in the area.Normally I stay always in the center of Frankfurt. When I arrived the check in was ok but nobody offered to help me with the luggage.The room decoration is boring a typical decoration as most of the american type hotels have but the size of the room was good and the bed was big and comfortable also.The problem was an old aircondition they have in the room which makes a lot of noise but no cool air..was more like a fan..when I called the reception an older guy replied and said that I just have to wait 2 hours more as around 23:00 o' clock the aircondition will be shut down and I will be able to sleep.. no comments!He did not offer to send somebody in order to check the aircon or to offer me another room with a better working Air Condition.I liked very much the room service afterwards as they were quick and very kind and the burger was perfect.Also the breakfast was really good like i am used in Germany and even better.Very expensive WIFI cost 8 euro per hour and it is not possible to use it from a standard room but only downstairs at the lobby.In order to get connected from your room you have to take out the cable from the phone etc.How can they be a business hotel having an ancient internet technology? Overall a quite good middleclass hotel to stay if they fix the aircon and put some wireless stations in the floors.
Reviews.Author: Pantheo36

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and staff We can't say enough good things about the manager Ulf and his staff. We were difficult travellers, having 100kgs of luggage from mountaineering expeditions with us. Half of that needed to be sent home to the US, and other half kept here and washed. It was no problem to find us boxes and arrange the shipping for us. Also, it was no problem for them to direct us to a laundromat with our ton of clothing (that they could have profited from at the hotel). Our room was very clean and quiet, with a wondeful view of the surrounding forest trails (it was great watching the landing aircraft into FRA). And the bed was simply divine!Don't be afraid to stay here as tourists -- although it is a business oriented hotel, the hotel is next door to many forest trails (bicycle, horse, walking).
Reviews.Author: MountainFrau

Reviews.Content: best of Frankfurt FOR BUSINESS My fifth stay at the hotel this year and all I can say, is that the service is outstanding .The hotel staff is very courteous and the front desk manager Ulf is definitely the friendliest and most professional in the business. highly recommend the hotel if you are going to be in Frankfurt for business.
Reviews.Author: jurasien

Reviews.Content: When a stay is wonderful and fabulous - blame it on the management When one has a wonderful stay it is because the management has trained the staff as well as leading by example. The comfort level for the guest is so high at the Arabella Congress because the staff thinks what can we do to make the guest's stay more enjoyable I have been staying in this hotel ever since several managers relocated here from another Starwood property in Frankfurt.Even though the location is not as convenient as the hotel at which I was staying I am willing to come here because I do feel at home!The staff does the best job one can expect and it is a joy to speak with a group of very interested hoteliers.
Reviews.Author: shoepeddler

Reviews.Content: Pretty awful experience Stayed here on a business trip because colleague wanted Starwood points. Basically, the hotel is fine if you have a meeting with the business park (Nestle etc.) where it exists outside of Frankfurt proper. Other than that, STAY AWAY.1) Had to change room after first night due to completely lame a/c. They brought a fan to my room! I thought this is a $325 room and my a/c is a fan?2) The lobby bar/lounge service is very lazy and again, the air is STILL and very hot. Overheard other Americans saying the same thing.3) Returned to room after a business day at 3:15pm and room had not been cleaned. I told them I would sit in the lobby while room was cleaned since I had business to attend to.4) Hotel is approximately 20 euros by taxi from town center or popular exhibition space Messe Frankfurt. A quite expensive commute when done daily....For a business hotel it was an overall awful experience.Happily, moving to the Frankfurt Marriott tomorrow!
Reviews.Author: Lulu-Weston

Reviews.Content: Great Meeting Location We had a fantastic meeting in this hotel. Staff was great, especially the Meeting Concierges and the service people. Just nothing was impossible.Though the rooms are nothing special and the location is off center, we enjoyed our time, had excellent food and great get togethers at the newly renovated lobby bar.Jogging in the park or swimming in the big hotel pool were a welcome change after the meetings.Would recommend it any time!
Reviews.Author: viveleww

Reviews.Content: hotelguest Great hotel, great location. Near airport (10min.); near fair (shutlte bus for 6.- Euro). Direct connection by tram to the old city.Rooms furnishing OK, but nothing special. Great view (had a room with balcony on the executive floor). In room coffee maker, 2 bottles comp water, bathrobe.Friendly staff and great breakfast buffet.
Reviews.Author: BerlinHotelguest

Reviews.Content: Fine hotel, no complaints I stayed there for 2 nights with my fiance and have no complaints at all. The staff was very friendly and polite. We stayed in a executive room which was well equipped and also clean. The breakfast was very good. We had no complaints at all. The location is great, and near to all major shopping facilities in downtown Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: sean_e78

Reviews.Content: No frills, but nice place to stay in Frankfurt This hotel is very average in most regards, smallish rooms, and not all of them have the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper bed this hotel even advertises in the lobby. Comfortable rooms, that are mostly very quite, and peaceful. Some are on the end of the building with small balcony overlooking a forest, and an equestrian center with the airport in the distance. There is a computer in the lobby for checking email, but unlike most tourist hotels there is a charge for using it. The pool downstairs has a rock wall waterfall feature, a very nice sauna and is clean and very relaxing after a long day working or playing. The food in the restaurant is above average, and reasonably priced and the service is effecient, not overly friendly but nice service.
Reviews.Author: autobiztravel

Reviews.Content: Good, if you are aware of the locations       Wardrobe and nightstand
Reviews.Author: Gernereiserin

Reviews.Content: relaxing Stayed at this hotel on business, and as you would expect a good clean hospitable hotel.The staff were very accomadating, particularly the bar staff who even cooked us toasted sandwich's well into the early hours after the bar had closed.I found the service on the bar a little slow however as not enough staff were evident earlier in the evening.The rooms were very comfortable, with good bathrooms that were clean tidy and not at all tired.I would be happy to recomend this hotel as a good business hotel.
Reviews.Author: williamc

Reviews.Content: Good hotel no complaints I stayed there for one night and have no complaints at all. There are some signs of outworn carpets, so the hotel will need a bit of renovation the next years, but the standard and hospitality is 4 star. Bathroom is end of 1980麓s style but very clean. Staff was very friendly and polite. Singe room was well equipped and also clean. The breakfast was very good. Check out very fast. No complaints at all. Location is excellant, near to all major shopping facilities in downtown Francfort.
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802

Reviews.Content: Expensive small room Just returned from a business trip to Frankfurt and I am all too aware that the pricing of hotels there is outrageous. I chose this hotel due to the location near to the Messe Frankfurt Fairgrounds (about 17 euros each way via taxi, according to the front desk staff there was no direct shuttle service from the hotel). If you are going to downtown Frankfurt, there is a tram stop directly across from the hotel (Niederrad-Burostadt), the ride is about 20 minutes. The Sheraton Congress offered friendly service and clean rooms, as I have come to expect from all the Starwood brands. That being said, 345 euros per night for a room of approximately 150 - 175 square feet with a small double bed was not worth the cost. In addition, charging an additional 19 euros for each buffet breakfast was ridiculous. Hotel restaurant Tonic served decent Italian food for dinner and around the corner from the hotel is a good Asian restaurant.
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer

Reviews.Content: interesting       interior of our room
Reviews.Author: amgdharper

Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but good enough We stayed at the Arabella Sheraton Congress on two occasions, flying into and out of Germany. The hotel is modern and conveniently located to the airport.and is in an area with offices and other businesses, and is convenient to the tram downtown. The rooms are modern and clean, but small. If one was alone, the rooms would be adequate, but for two persons it was somewhat crowded. The restaurant is not easy to find, but the food was very good. In summary, it is adequate and convenient.
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway

Reviews.Content: Mid Level business hotel Stayed for Business. Mid-level hotel. Nothing great. Room is small by American Standards. Nice decor otherwise. Reminds me of a dorm. Single full bed. Table against wall. TV on table. One closet. Small refrig.(I did not open). Was probably 100 sq ft. total. Notice that bed comforter is the same size as the bed. i.e. if the bed is 5 x 6 then the comforter is 5 x 6. I found this strange as I am use to a comforter that is larger than the bed so that the comforter will hang over the side of the bed.Unique bathroom design with no bathtub. Shower only. Design without shower door or curtain.During stay, noticed a lot of tourist groups would stayed. This affected the service of the resturant.Room very clean. No issues with service or housekeeping.
Reviews.Author: patrickf88

Reviews.Content: Good Airport Hotel I stayed at the Arabella Sheraton Congress when I had an overnight flight connection at Frankfurt. The hotel was typical for a Sheraton - decent sized rooms, good breakfast, clean - but nothing exceptional. It serves as a good airport hotel if you have an early flight connection, but I wouldn't stay here if you are planning on exploring Frankfurt.The biggest drawback is that it doesn't have an airport shuttle. A taxi was Eur 13 from the airport, even though it's only a few miles away. The other option is a train from the airport, which is fast, but it's a 10 minute walk from the train station to the hotel. This is ok if you don't have a lot of luggage, but would be annoying with a lot of bags. The train is Eur 3. Many travel sites have this hotel on special, and I was able to book a US69 rate. It's definitely worth it at that price, though if the price was much higher I think you could do better at another property.
Reviews.Author: schmare

Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok! Business hotel as usual. Not super attractive, but good service, friendly staff and quiet nice rooms. The rooms are renovated, clean and ok. Even the small restaurant (Stube) is not to bad. This hotel is on a good 4-star level. Dont expect 5star-luxury and you want be disappointed. I will stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again My booking was for a room with 1K bed made of 2S bed. I got a tiny little room with 1 single bed. I complained, and they gave me a room with 2 separate single beds. And I am a SPG Platinum card holder. Couldn't be bothered to complain yet again as I was only given the new room on returning to the hotel after 10 pm. Won't stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Bondosan006
